metadata.title: CVE-2021-45910 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in gif2apng 1.9. There is a heap-based buffer overflow within the main function. It allows an attacker to write data outside of the allocated buffer. The attacker has control over a part of the address that data is written to, control over the written data, and (to some extent) control over the amount of data that is written.

criterions.comment: gif2apng package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
